content:
Absolutely, supporting residents in this transition is just as important as promoting economic growth. Many residents in Atlantic City have been impacted by the recent economic downturn, and it's important to provide them with resources and assistance.

The city government and local organizations can provide job training programs, financial counseling, and other resources to help residents find employment or start businesses. Additionally, providing affordable housing and access to healthcare and social services can also help support residents during this transition.

Overall, it's important for the city to take a comprehensive and holistic approach to revitalizing its economy, one that takes into account the needs of all its residents. By doing so, Atlantic City can build a more resilient and sustainable economy that benefits everyone in the community.
